Event Description: February 2024: PRCS volunteer paramedic killed.

25 February 2024: A Red Cross and UN evacuation convoy carrying patients from a Red Cross hospital was blocked by Israeli forces, despite prior coordination with Israeli authorities. Patients and staff were forced from ambulances, paramedics were stripped, and three Red Cross paramedics were detained, delaying the convoy for over seven hours. Two paramedics remained in detention.
23 February 2024: A Red Cross volunteer paramedic and five others including two women and two children were killed when an Israeli airstrike hit his family home.

As reported on 14 February 2024: A PRCS ambulance was hit by Israeli gunfire whilst attempting to transfer oxygen cylinders from one hospital to another. An unspecified number of PRCS staff members were injured.

09 February 2024: Nine PRCS staff members, including four doctors, four patients and five family members of patients were arrested by Israeli soldiers during a ten-hour raid on a PRCS hospital. Soldiers destroyed several medical devices; seized money, laptops and walkie-talkies; stole the key of ambulance and administrative vehicles and locked the steering wheels, preventing medical staff from operating the vehicles. On 16 February, two of the doctors were released and reported torture, while seven staff remain under arrest.

07 February 2024: A PRCS paramedic was killed, and two paramedics injured when an ambulance team deployed to evacuate injured Palestinians from the north was hit between two hospitals. A woman and her three injured children were inside the ambulance at the time of the attack. The crew were reportedly trapped for at least an hour.

05 February 2024: The General Director and Administrative Director of a Red Cross hospital were detained by Israeli forces and taken to an unknown location, after an agreement was reached with Israel to provide a safe passage for evacuation.
February 2024: A health INGO staff was killed during fighting.
05 February 2024: Two PRCS volunteers were arrested while passing through the humanitarian corridor set up by the Israeli military.

02 February 2024: A Red Cross youth-department director was killed by Israeli gunfire on the Red Cross headquarters. The continued shelling hinders the transfer of casualties to the Red Cross hospital.  Two more Palestinians were killed and three others injured.

01 February 2024: The wife of a Red Cross ambulance driver was arrested by Israeli soldiers reportedly to pressure her husband to turn himself in. The ambulance driver and his brother, also a PRCS ambulance driver, both turned themselves in and were arrested. His pregnant wife was reportedly transferred to prison.
01 February 2024: A female Red Cross aid worker was shot dead.
31 January 2024: A Red Cross security guard and a member of staff at a hospital were killed after being shot by Israeli soldiers.

January 2024: Two international aid workers  were killed, and another four international INGO aid workers injured when they were hit by suspected Russian forces loitering munitions during a field assessment.
Reported Perpetrator Name: Armed Forces of the Russian Federation

Event Description: 30 January 2024: A PRCS hospital and adjacent headquarters was hit with shrapnel, resulting in one fatality and nine injuries among IDPs taking refuge there.
January 2024: An unspecified number of aid workers were arrested by SAF military intelligence.
29 January 2024: Israeli forces beat up and detained a volunteer paramedic during an ongoing night raid into the area.

29 January 2024: A PRCS ambulance crew were missing for at least 89 hours after they set out to rescue a trapped child. The bodies of the two paramedics were found with their bombed ambulance on 10 February, a few metres away from the vehicle the child was trapped in.
January 2024: Three aid workers were shot and killed by gunmen.
January 2024: A humanitarian vehicle clearly marked was hit, injuring an aid worker while distributing relief supplies to civilians in the town.
Reported Perpetrator Name: Armed Forces of the Russian Federation

Event Description: 23 January 2024: A humanitarian worker was reportedly arrested near a hospital by Israeli forces during their besiege of the facility.

18 January 2024: Two organisation's guesthouses were hit by an airstrike. This incident caused injuries to several medical and operational team members, significant damage to the building, and required the withdrawal of six international emergency medical team members from Gaza.
18 January 2024: In Qansaxley IDP camp, Doolow town, Gedo region, a government soldier (SNA) opened fire at a locally rented LNGO vehicle inside the camp, injuring an aid worker.

18 January 2024: An INGO compound, housing various medical staff, was severely damaged as a result of a missile strike. A number of team members and the compoundâ€™s security guard were injured. Following the strike, they were evacuated.
17 January 2024: In Tulkarm Refugee Camp, a male and a female PRCS paramedic were injured after an Israeli airstrike hit an ambulance.
17 January 2024: In Tulkarm Refugee Camp, Israeli forces detained three PRCS staff members while they were performing their duty.
January 2024: Two gunmen on motorbikes opened fire at an aid worker, injuring him.
January 2024: A Red Cross ambulance driver was shot while on duty in a vehicle clearly marked with the organisation's emblem. He was severely injured and died before reaching hospital.
January 2024: Three national INGO aid workers were kidnapped by Boko Haram fighters while on a project visit.

10 January 2024: In Maghazi Refugee Camp, four PRCS ambulance crew members were killed and two injured by Israeli bombing while travelling inside an ambulance transporting wounded civilians. All passengers, including a photographer who joined to document the scene, were killed.
January 2024: An INGO security guard was stabbed to death by unidentified perpetrators at the organisation's health facility.
January 2024:  Israeli forces shot dead seven aid workers on board trucks delivering flour to IDPs sheltering in schools.
January 2024: A volunteer organisation guard and two other civilians were kidnapped by Wagner mercenaries.
07 December 2023: A health INGO worker was killed by Israeli bombardments on his neighbourhood.
January 2024: A doctor working for the NGO ADRA was shot and killed in front of his house by gunmen.
January 2024: Three LNGO workers and an ambulance were arrested by junta police. Two LNGO workers were later released but the ambulance and driver were detained.
06 January 2024: One international volunteer was killed by unknown actors. His body was found by the Wagner group.
January 2024: A national INGO aid worker was shot and killed by armed men.
05 January 2024: An off-duty INGO driver and three civilians were killed by unidentified armed actors during an attack on the village.
January 2024: A national INGO aid worker was shot and killed by unidentified perpetrators.
January 2024: An unspecified number of young men working in Emergency Monitoring Rooms run by local volunteers and aid organisations were tortured by suspected SAF members.

02 January 2024: The PRCS headquarters, which is located within a hospital, was hit by Israeli bombing, killing five, including a five-day-old newborn baby, and injuring three among the displaced individuals seeking refuge at the PRCS premises. A volunteer first-responder was among the injured.
January 2024: A volunteer staff member was kidnapped by suspected Wagner Group members.

January 2024: Thousands of IDPs were forced out of their shelter when a tank partially destroyed a nearby school by Israeli forces. In the aftermath, 27 IDPs and three INGO employees were detained, with the men separated and left in their underwear.

Event Description: January 2024: A national INGO aid worker was injured by another aid worker in a disagreement.
December 2023: A humanitarian worker was killed by Israeli naval ships.
26 December 2023: Health workers were arrested from the Red Cross headquarters by Israeli soldiers and taken to an unknown destination.

December 2023: The SAF beat and arrested several young volunteers while they were providing services to IDPs at a market. Other volunteers were also arrested. Several volunteers were later released, but four remained detained.

December 2023: An LNGO ambulance transporting an injured junta policeman was attacked by the local resistance forces, killing the injured policeman and accompanying four policemen.  The ambulance was torched and the two LNGO workers were abducted. They were later released
22 December 2023: Israeli forces stormed the PRCS ambulance centre, where they arrested eight PRCS employees. The military also destroyed ambulances and part of the PRCS headquarters.
December 2023: An INGO staff member was killed alongside his wife, three sons, and two daughters as an airstrike hit the area where they were sheltering.
21 December 2023: In Jabalia Refugee Camp, a female nurse working at a NGO besieged hospital was shot by Israeli snipers. The hospital continues to be besieged after 17 days.

21 December 2023: A besieged ambulance centre was stormed by Israelli forces who arrested at least 14 team members and paramedics, taking them to an unknown location. Women were trapped alone inside the centre. The following day, some staff and paramedics were released after being beaten. Eight staff members remained in custody. The wireless communication system in the centre was also destroyed during the raid. On 19th January, one volunteer was released. Five others still remain in custody.
20 December 2023: PRCS staff were amongst 12 injured when Israeli airstrikes hit the vicinity of a IO hospital and their headquarters.

December 2023: A national NGO aid worker was beaten and injured by the Central African Armed Forces (FACA) after accidently hitting a child when riding his motorbike and taking him for medical attention.
19 December 2023: An IO employee and three IDPs sheltering in a school got injured.

18 December 2023: A NGO hospital was stormed and taken over by Israeli forces who destroyed the main entrance and ordered everyone, including medical staff, to leave. At least two doctors were arrested. The hospital is out of service.
17 December 2023: A PRCS volunteer was arrested by Israeli forces from an ambulance while heading to transport a medical case from the camp after obtaining coordination.

17 December 2023: 21 health workers, including six INGO staff and the director of a NGO hospital were detained by Israeli forces. They were stripped and interrogated before their release. The hospital director was taken away and his whereabouts are unclear.
December 2023: An LNGO president was abducted from her home by the Myanmar military on accusations of being a People’s Defence Force informant.
As reported on 12 December 2023: An INGO aid worker was killed alongside his family, in an Israeli airstrike.
December 2023: An INGO staff member was detained by police.
December 2023: An aid worker was kidnapped for a day by the RSF. The building was also looted and vandalised.
11 December 2023: Two PRCS paramedics were stopped, forced out of the ambulance and beaten by Israeli soldiers after confrontations broke out in the village.
11 December 2023: A doctor was shot and injured by an Israeli sniper while at a NGO besieged hospital.
10 December 2023: A Red Cross volunteer was killed during Israeli bombing.
December 2023: A national NGO aid worker was wounded when armed men ambushed a private vehicle. Two other civilians were also injured.
December 2023: Two people were killed and seven injured including three staff members, as a convoy was attacked by the SAF while evacuating civilians
09 December 2023: Two health workers were reportedly shot and killed by Israeli forces during the continued siege of a NGO hospital.

09 December 2023: During the inspection of a PRCS convoy returning from a hospital, a paramedic was detained for the second time by Israeli soldiers. He was beaten, threatened, stripped naked and handcuffed, and upon his release, was forced to walk over the checkpoint for more than two kms.

09 December 2023: A convoy of six PRCS ambulances, accompanied by UN vehicles, was subjected to a two-hour inspection by Israeli forces whilst crossing a military checkpoint which separated the north of the strip from the south in order to evacuate critically ill patients from a hospital. Two paramedics were detained and released once the convoy was allowed to pass.

08 December 2023: A NGO hospital worker was shot and killed by an Israeli sniper stationed around the hospital after he stood too close to a window. The son of another staff member was also shot and injured.
08 December 2023: The cleaner of a NGO hospital was killed by an Israeli sniper stationed around the hospital.
As reported on 07 December 2023: A female staff member went missing, believed to be detained by Israeli forces.

Event Description: 07 December 2023: Israeli forces opened fire at a NGO hospital, killing a senior medical nurse and an unspecified number of others. The hospital was also damaged by shells.

07 December 2023: A male researcher was arrested when Israeli forces stormed a project area. Hundreds of other Palestinians were also detained, including a 48-year-old school director, and a 56-year-old staffer.
05 December 2023: Two Red Cross ambulances were damaged by Israeli tank artillery while they were responding to casualties. A paramedic was injured.
December 2023: A male INGO worker was arrested by the Myanmar military
05 December 2023: In Jenin Refugee Camp, a Red Cross crew were assaulted by Israeli forces after coordination was made to transfer a medical case from inside the camp.

December 2023: An unspecified number of aid workers were kidnapped by CODECO fighters while they were returning from a mission. Mobile phones, computers, suitcases containing clothes, and money were also taken.
December 2023: A national INGO aid worker was shot and killed by unidentified armed men.

December 2023: INGO guard arrested along with his familly after a complaint from a neighbour following a brawl. He spent 72h in detention and was forced to pay a fine to be released. He contracted malaria in detention.
November 2023: Five UNRWA personnel were killed.

November 2023: An INGO team was stopped by the army at the entrance to the city as they were returning from the IDP camps. The team was detained for 45 minutes, untill the INGO's security manager and field coordinator managed to contact the regional authorities to facilitate the team's release.

The group overran government forces, killing at least 40 soldiers and 20 civilians before reaching the humanitarian hub, where over 50 aid workers were present at the time. Protective security measures deployed at the hub prevented any harm to the staff inside.
